TextLibrary.Text: Queen Ehlanna
Your Majesty, I have a request.
Your Majesty, I have a request.
Your Majesty, I have a request.
Your Majesty, I have a request.
Of course. We are happy to oblige.
Of course. We are happy to oblige.
Of course. We are happy to oblige.
Of course. We are happy to oblige.

I have befriended one of the Winter Wolves who lives on the Tundra. Lord Bane's Undead are constantly raiding his homeland. It would serve your kingdom well if we could protect the wolves - it would stop them traveling south and crossing paths with your people. Is there any way you could help?

I have befriended one of the Winter Wolves who lives on the Tundra. Lord Bane's Undead are constantly raiding his homeland. It would serve your kingdom well if we could protect the wolves - it would stop them traveling south and crossing paths with your people. Is there any way you could help?

I have befriended one of the Winter Wolves who lives on the Tundra. Lord Bane's Undead are constantly raiding his homeland. It would serve your kingdom well if we could protect the wolves - it would stop them traveling south and crossing paths with your people. Is there any way you could help?
We can spare no warriors. We are outnumbered ten to one already!
We can spare no warriors. We are outnumbered ten to one already!
We can spare no warriors. We are outnumbered ten to one already!
We can spare no warriors. We are outnumbered ten to one already!
I was thinking more along the lines of a spell. Like one of the spells you use to protect the Citadel here.
I was thinking more along the lines of a spell. Like one of the spells you use to protect the Citadel here.
I was thinking more along the lines of a spell. Like one of the spells you use to protect the Citadel here.
I was thinking more along the lines of a spell. Like one of the spells you use to protect the Citadel here.

We will place our blessing upon a stone. Deliver it to the wolves. It will not stop the Undead forever, but its presence will cause them a small measure of pain - enough to keep them at bay for a time.

Thank you, your Majesty.
Thank you, your Majesty.
Thank you, your Majesty.
